abstract: Winning so many leases so soon after being cleared to seek new drilling rights was an important milestone in the company’s quest to recover from the 2010 disaster in the Gulf of Mexico.
snippet: Winning so many leases so soon after being cleared to seek new drilling rights was an important milestone in the company’s quest to recover from the 2010 disaster in the Gulf of Mexico.
lead_paragraph: LONDON — Just days after the United States lifted a ban on new oil and gas leases for BP, the company took full advantage of the opportunity. In an auction held in New Orleans on Wednesday, BP was the high bidder on 24 exploration blocks in the Gulf of Mexico for about $42 million, according to the Interior Department.

headline.main: Ban Lifted, BP Bids $42 Million to Win Gulf Oil Leases in U.S. Auction
headline.print_headline: Ban Lifted, BP Bids $42 Million to Win Gulf Oil Leases in U.S. Auction
